definition: to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]

sentences.english: Would self-sacrificing emerge in natural selection?
sentences.chinese: 自我牺牲会在自然选择中出现吗？

sentences.english: He concluded that these expressions evolved through natural selection.
sentences.chinese: 他得出结论，这此表达方式经自然选择演变而来。

sentences.english: All Darwin perceived was that selection must work in nature, too.
sentences.chinese: 达尔文所理解的也就是自然选择，物竞天择。

sentences.english: In natural selection, certain things happen.
Natural selection can also, sometimes, be an agent of genetic uniformity.
sentences.chinese: 有时，自然选择也是物种特性统一的推动者。

sentences.english: As one fisherman just told me, this is natural selection.
sentences.chinese: 正如一名渔民告诉我的，这是一种自然选择。

sentences.english: So it really does matter whether natural selection is true.
sentences.chinese: 因此自然选择究竟是否正确，真的非常重要。

sentences.english: In our book we review a large and varied selection of non-environmental constraints on trait transmission.
sentences.chinese: 在本书中我们回顾了多种多样非自然选择的性状遗传。

sentences.english: The Columbine High School tragedy occurred because of the idea of “natural selection”.
sentences.chinese: 科隆比纳高中发生的悲剧是因为“自然选择”的想法。

sentences.english: It is important not to mis-state the reach of natural selection.
sentences.chinese: 值得指出的是，不要弄错了自然选择的适用范围。

sentences.english: The root cause of these can explain by the Lysenkoism of natural selection of Darwin.
sentences.chinese: 究其根本原因，可以用达尔文的自然选择学说来解释。

sentences.english: Intraspecific selection Natural selection acting on individuals of the same species.
sentences.chinese: 指在同种个体间进行的自然选择。

definition: to multiply/to reproduce/to increase gradually in number or quantity
